10.23.17  7:22 pm   So my parents aren't musicians but my mom tells me she used to obsessively play classical music a bunch while she was pregnant with me. I didn't touch a keyboard until I was 6 or 7. Anyway, now I'm 20 and I've been doing music stuff for like 10+ years with few lessons(or direction) but I know middle "C" indefinitely. And because I know "C" i can figure out every other note too(maybe I'm not explaining this right) my point is i can figure out any notes to a thing as long as I think from "C" first. I explained this to my teacher and he was like "that's perfect pitch" but I always thought perfect pitch was effortless.

10.23.17  2:31 pm   I feel like I'm stuck on a plateau in terms of creativity/skill and don't know how to keep climbing up. I know the solution is not think about how 'good' my stuff is and just to keep writing, which I am doing.. but I'm  getting frustrated and having a hard time being satisfied with the stuff I make. When I was first learning I could write something super simple using just open chords or something, and I'd fall in love with it. Be so proud of it and show off my new song to all my friends.. The funny thing is I like a lot of those first songs I wrote just as much, if not more, than the stuff I'm doing now. And I think a lot of it has to do with the mindset I had then. I remember first learning how to play a C7 chord and thinking 'Oh man, this is so cool!!' Have you ever felt like you reached the top of a plateau?

10.22.17  7:00 pm   Hey, just a heads up... i was reading through the random questions and there's a question from 3.21.16Â  12:01 pmÂ Â "what are we" and your response is "by that point, i was well into emergency "crunch time" mode, trying to finish vines as fast as humanly possible in order to make time to work on an extremely long video i was trying to get started. ideally for that vine i would have found a broad range of different movies, but instead i just grabbed them all from the same page, literally the first page i found with a lot of movie images. as a result, i think they are all 2013 movies"... I'm guessing something happened where the answer was mismatched with the question or something? Sorry if you don't like people pointing out this kind of stuff.
